title: How to Open WordPad in Windows 10 in Simple Steps

steps.title: Click the search bar/icon on the taskbar.
steps.content: Click the search bar /icon on the taskbar. If it's missing, then click on the Start button.

steps.title: Type wordpad.
steps.content: Type wordpad .

steps.title: Hit the ↵ Enter key or select the matching result.
steps.content: Hit the ↵ Enter key or select the matching result.

steps.title: Click on the Start button.
steps.content: Click on the Start button.

steps.title: Open the All apps list from the left of the Start menu.
steps.content: Open the All apps list from the left of the Start menu. You can also scroll if you've configured it to show on the tiles page.

steps.title: Click the "Windows Accessories" folder.
steps.content: Click the "Windows Accessories" folder.

steps.title: Choose "WordPad".
steps.content: Choose "WordPad".

steps.title: Press the ⊞ Win+R keyboard keys at the same time.
steps.content: Press the ⊞ Win + R keyboard keys at the same time.

steps.title: Type write, wordpad, or %SystemDrive%/Program Files/Windows NT/Accessories/WordPad.exe.
steps.content: Type write , wordpad , or %SystemDrive%/Program Files/Windows NT/Accessories/WordPad.exe .

steps.title: Hit the ↵ Enter key or click OK.
steps.content: Hit the ↵ Enter key or click OK .

steps.title: Open File Explorer
steps.content: Open File Explorer . You can do this quickly by clicking the taskbar icon or pressing ⊞ Win + E .

steps.title: Type %SystemDrive%/Program Files/Windows NT/Accessories.
steps.content: Type %SystemDrive%/Program Files/Windows NT/Accessories . Hit ↵ Enter or click the right arrow → . You can also manually navigate to the folder, replacing "%SystemDrive%" with your drive letter (usually C: ).

steps.title: Open the "wordpad" executable file.
steps.content: Open the "wordpad" executable file. It might have ".exe" at the end of the name depending on your file viewing settings.

steps.title: Open the Command Prompt.
steps.content: Open the Command Prompt. One way is to right-click the Start button and click Command Prompt . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Type write or wordpad.exe.
steps.content: Type write or wordpad.exe .

steps.title: Hit ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Hit ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Run Powershell.
steps.content: Run Powershell. Type powershell into the taskbar search bar (or launch the Start menu and type if the bar is missing).

steps.title: Select "Windows PowerShell".
steps.content: Select "Windows PowerShell". Ignore any advanced results that may appear (such as "PowerShell ISE" and "PowerShell (x86)"). [5] X Research source

steps.title: Wait until you see the Microsoft copyright info at the top.
steps.content: Wait until you see the Microsoft copyright info at the top. Depending on your computer, there might be a delay of up to 5 seconds until this appears.

steps.title: Type write.exe.
steps.content: Type write.exe .

steps.title: Hit ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Hit ↵ Enter .
